name: Tier
description: Tags related to tiering of the data. Tiers capture the business importance of data.

children.name: Tier1
children.description:
**Critical Source of Truth business data assets of an organization**

- Used in critical metrics and dashboards to drive business and product decisions

- Used in critical compliance reporting to regulators, govt entities, and third party

- Used in brand or revenue impacting online user-facing experiences (search results, advertisement, promotions, and experimentation)

- Other high impact use, such as ML models and fraud detection

- Source used to derive other critical Tier-1 datasets

children.name: Tier2
children.description:
**Important business datasets for your company (not as critical as Tier 1)**

- Used in important business metrics, product metrics, and dashboards to drive internal decisions

- Used in important compliance reporting to major regulators, govt entities, and third party

- Used for less critical online user-facing experiences (user activity, user behavior)

- Source used to derive other critical Tier-2 datasets

children.name: Tier3
children.description:
**Department/group level datasets that are typically non-business and general internal system**

- Used in product metrics, and dashboards to drive product decisions

- Used to track operational metrics of internal systems

- Source used to derive other critical Tier-3 datasets

children.name: Tier4
children.description:
**Team level datasets that are typically non-business and general internal system**

- Used in product metrics, and dashboards to drive team decisions

- Used to track operational metrics of internal systems owned by the team

- Source used to derive other critical Tier-4 datasets

children.name: Tier5
children.description:
**Private/Unused data assets - No impact beyond individual users**

- Data assets without any ownership with no usage in the last 60 days

- Data assets owned by individuals without team ownership
